titles.title: Stop Meth Labs and Enhance Patient Access Act of 2014

To authorize the Attorney General to exempt certain products from the requirements of subsections (d) and (e) of section 310 of the Controlled Substances Act if it is not practical to use such products in the illicit manufacture of methamphetamine.
Stop Meth Labs and Enhance Patient Access Act of 2014

bill.summary: Stop Meth Labs and Enhance Patient Access Act of 2014 - Amends the Controlled Substances Act to authorize the Attorney General to exempt a scheduled listed chemical product from specified requirements regarding sales quantity, nonliquid forms, and retail transactions upon determining that it is not practical by processes known to be employed by clandestine laboratory operators to use the product in the illicit manufacture of methamphetamine (currently, upon determining that the product cannot be used in the illicit manufacture of methamphetamine).
